items.question: What should I do if I am unorganized?
items.answer: If you find yourself struggling to schedule your day or running late frequently, there's a lot of things that you can do. Try to always think in advance about what's going to happen and what you need to do, and consider using the night before each day to prep. You can set out your clothes in advance, for example, so that you don't have to worry about getting dressed in the morning. Another thing you can do is keep your keys by the door so that you're not scrambling to find your keys each day.

items.question: What should I keep in mind when planning a daily schedule?
items.answer: Try to do the one thing you don't like the most on your schedule first. Getting that off your plate will make the rest of your day so much easier, as opposed to doing all the easy stuff and dreading that big task you have left to do.

items.answer: Organizing your thoughts helps you to have a clear mind to accomplish your tasks. If your mind is a chaotic jumble of thoughts, ideas, and to-dos, itâ€™s tough to accomplish anything. Plus, things will likely get overlooked, or youâ€™ll miss deadlines.

items.question: Why do I struggle to organize my thoughts?
items.answer: You may struggle to organize your thoughts simply because itâ€™s not a habit. Your brain likes to be in a state of chaos. Over time, as you regularly organize your thoughts, you will retrain your brain to come into order and be less out of control.

items.question: What are the benefits of organizing your thoughts before you begin to speak?
items.answer: The benefits of organizing your thoughts before you begin to speak are: communicating with fluency, being more charismatic, getting your point across, and less need to use filler words. This is especially beneficial in work situations as you will appear more competent.

items.question: How do you organize your thoughts when talking?
items.answer: To organize your thoughts when talking, take a 3-second pause and use that time to quickly think of the main point of what you want to say. As you talk, organize your thoughts by focusing on what you are saying and how you can link each idea to the next one. If you find your thoughts racing or muddled, take a calm breath and pause.
